text: Margaret Discovery Discovered by Scott S. Sheppard, and David C. Jewitt Discovered in August 29, 2003 Orbital characteristics Mean radius 14,345,000 km Eccentricity 0.6608 Orbital period 1687.01 d Inclination 57° (to the ecliptic)Scott S. Sheppard, David C. Jewitt, and Jan Kleyna An Ultradeep Survey for Irregular Satellites of Uranus: Limits to Completeness, The Astronomical Journal, 129 (2005), pages 518–525 . Preprint Is a moon of Uranus Physical characteristics Mean diameter ~20 km (estimate) Surface area ~1300 km2 (estimate) Volume ~4000 km3 (estimate) Mass ~1.0 kg (estimate) Mean density ~1.5 g/cm3 (estimate) Surface gravity ~0.0023 m/s2 (estimate) Escape velocity ~0.005 km/s (estimate) Rotation period ? Axial tilt ?° Albedo 0.04 (assumed) Surface temp. {| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="2" border="0" min mean max ~65 K (estimate) Margaret is the only prograde non-spherical moon of Uranus. It was found by Scott S. Sheppard, et al. in 2003 and given the designation S/2003 U 3.IAU Circular 8217 Confirmed as Uranus XXIII, it was named after the servant of Hero in William Shakespeare's play Much Ado About NothingPlanetary names USGS. ==Orbit== Margaret stands out as the only prograde non-spherical moon of Uranus. The diagram illustrates the orbital parameters of Margaret, unique among the non-spherical moons of Uranus, with inclination on the vertical axis and the eccentricity of the orbits represented by the segments extending from the pericentre to the apocentre. ==Related pages== *List of Uranus' moons https//ifarley.net ==References== * Ephemeris: IAU-NSES * Mean orbital parameters: NASA JPL ==Other websites== *Margaret Profile by NASA's Solar System Exploration *David Jewitt pages *Scott Sheppard pages Category:Uranus' moons
title: Margaret (moon)
